body: With a $6.3 million gift from a charitable foundation, New York City is opening up for recreation thousands of acres of urban wilderness in 21 locations around the city, many of them just a subway ride away from Times Square. "We have wild and wonderful places that only need to be made more accessible," said Betsy Gotbaum, the city's Commissioner
title: Urban Gift: Wilderness Regained

body: The state court decision on Tuesday barring top New York City officials from holding political party offices set the stage yesterday for a battle over the Brooklyn Democratic leadership. title: Brooklyn Democrats Fight for Top Party Post

body: LEAD: George Washington never slept in Hendrick I. Lott's farmhouse. body: LEAD: A computer programmer from Park Slope and a secretary from Williamsburg were chosen to fill the last two seats in a Brooklyn jury box yesterday, clearing the way for the start of the Bensonhurst murder trial on Monday.
